text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel welcome back to my
kitchen today I got an exciting recipe
for you guys we're going to be making a
cha-cha barbecue pork now no trip to
Chinatown at least for me is without two
things the first of course is bubble tea
and the second is to check out the
delicious Asian pastries and also the
barbecue pork shops and one of my
favorite things to eat is of course
chashu barbecue pork there's that
distinctive red color that caramelized
glaze that's a little sweet and just the
really nice tender taste of the pork now
this recipe only needs six simple
ingredients for the marinade and once
you make this recipe I feel like you're
never going to want to buy barbecue pork
again it's just not going to be the same
so if you guys are interested in how to
make chashu pork at home keep watching
for this recipe we're gonna need one
tablespoon each of honey soy sauce you
can use light soy sauce or regular soy
sauce 1 tablespoon of rice wine 1
tablespoon of a soy sauce glaze which is
more of a thick soy sauce and if you're
wondering which type of soy sauce glaze
I got I will post a link in the video
description we'll also need 1 teaspoon
of five-spice powder and finally 1/4 cup
of brown sugar and for the meat itself
I'm using about a pound to a pound and a
half of pork but now you can also use
pork tenderloin in this recipe but I
feel like the pork butt makes it more
marbled and so you'll get some nice
pieces of fat making it more juicy and
tender now earlier I used a piercing
meat tenderizer on the pork which is
going to make our pork more tender and
able to absorb the marinade better and
once you're done tenderizing the pork
and measuring out all your ingredients
I'm going to put everything into this
nice plastic baggie
after you're done combining all the
ingredients and ensuring it's evenly
mixed within the bag store the pork in
the refrigerator to marinate over
night and so we don't have to wait I've
already pre-made a batch that we can use
now to cook we'll start by preheating an
oven to 375 to 400 degrees then place
the pork on a baking sheet lined with
aluminum foil set your timer to bake for
10 minutes and in the meantime let's
thicken the sauce in a saucepan pour the
remaining marinade from the bag and to
that I'm going to add another two
tablespoons of honey and guys it's
totally okay to eyeball it here if you
feel comfortable because this recipe is
pretty forgiving next stir and let that
sauce simmer and thicken for three to
five minutes once that's done it should
be time to check in on the pork now I'm
gonna add the thickened sauce to coat
the pork and flip and bake for another
eight to ten minutes or until done we
just want to make sure not to overcook
because the meat can get tough so keep
your oven temperatures in mind when
setting the oven up for preheating once
it's cooked transfer to a cutting board
and let the pork rest for five minutes
before slicing into bite-size pieces and
of course you can always brush on any
remaining sauce and juices from the
baking pan for some extra flavor
[Music]
and that guys is how you make Chavo
barbecue pork as you can see it was
super easy to make and we have this
beautiful plate here it smells so
delicious I can't wait to try it so I'm
just gonna do the taste test here so I'm
gonna get a nice fatty piece mmm
that was amazing the meat was really
moist and tender I had a little piece of
fat marbled in there which i think is
delicious
there was the flavors of the five-spice
the honey and the soy sauce it was just
perfect
I'm Angelo thank you guys so much for
watching if you liked today's video
recipe don't forget to give me a thumbs
up and if you've tried my recipe at home
and you like it
come post on instagram tag me on
instagram i'd love to see how your
recipe turned out until then take care
guys thank you guys for all your well
wishes in my last video and thoughts in
Paris I really appreciate it it really
keeps me going and I will see you guys
hopefully soon bye
you
